description: FOXNews.com - Breaking news and video. Latest Current News: U.S., World, Entertainment, Health, Business, Technology, Politics, Sports.

items.content: It has been incredibly moving these past months to meet so many people who felt their lives were touched by my father.
items.contentSnippet: It has been incredibly moving these past months to meet so many people who felt their lives were touched by my father.
items.creator: Daniel Krauthammer
items.dc:creator: Daniel Krauthammer
items.title: Daniel Krauthammer: In search of civility -- In our politics now, we are increasingly talking past each other

items.content: Charles Krauthammer was my father. Writing that sentence in the past tense is still a shock to me, and it evokes a sadness far too deep to express in words. My father and I were very close. I feel the pain of his absence every day, as does every son who loved his father. There were a thousand secret private things between us that I alone know and that I alone will miss.
items.contentSnippet: Charles Krauthammer was my father. Writing that sentence in the past tense is still a shock to me, and it evokes a sadness far too deep to express in words. My father and I were very close. I feel the pain of his absence every day, as does every son who loved his father. There were a thousand secret private things between us that I alone know and that I alone will miss.
items.creator: Daniel Krauthammer
items.dc:creator: Daniel Krauthammer
items.title: Daniel Krauthammer: An introduction to Charles Krauthammer’s ‘The Point of It All’

items.content: CIA Director Gina Haspel is expected to brief leaders of multiple Senate committees Tuesday about the October murder of Saudi activist and writer Jamal Khashoggi, a source told Fox News.

items.title: CIA Director Gina Haspel to brief Senate leaders on Khashoggi murder, source says

items.content: Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell says that despite solid economic progress, the country still faces a number of challenges including slow wage-growth for lower-income workers to sluggish productivity and an aging population.

items.title: Fed Chairman Powell says economic challenges remain

items.content: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan heaped praise on Venezuela's embattled socialist leader Monday as political and economic ties between the two countries blossom.

items.title: Turkish president praises Venezuela's leader in 1st visit

items.content: Kansas will swear in its first two openly LGBT state lawmakers next month and the new Democratic governor promises to end a ban on discrimination over sexual orientation or gender identity in state hiring or employment decisions once she takes office.
items.contentSnippet: Kansas will swear in its first two openly LGBT state lawmakers next month and the new Democratic governor promises to end a ban on discrimination over sexual orientation or gender identity in state hiring or employment decisions once she takes office.
items.creator: JOHN HANNA
items.dc:creator: JOHN HANNA
items.title: Kansas sees LGBT milestones, yet big change may come slowly

items.content: New information has been received that could shed light on the mysterious 1961 plane crash that killed U.N. Secretary-General Dag Hammarskjold on a peace mission to then newly independent Congo, the U.N. legal chief said Monday.

items.creator: EDITH M. LEDERER
items.dc:creator: EDITH M. LEDERER
items.title: UN: New information could shed light on Hammarskjold crash
